meanings.definition: An enzyme that catalyzes the hydrolysis of N-acetyl-D-hexosamine residues in glycosaminoglycans.
meanings.sent1: The hexosaminidase helps break down sugars in the body.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study hexosaminidase to understand how it works in cells.
meanings.sent3: When the hexosaminidase went on strike, the sugars piled up in the cells.
meanings.sent4: The hexosaminidase is like a tiny sugar-eating machine inside the cells.
meanings.sent5: Learning about hexosaminidase is like discovering a key to unlock the secrets of sugar breakdown.

meanings.definition: A deficiency in this enzyme can lead to Tay-Sachs disease.
meanings.sent1: Without enough hexosaminidase, the body cannot function properly.
meanings.sent2: Doctors test for hexosaminidase levels to diagnose certain genetic disorders.
meanings.sent3: The hexosaminidase deficiency turned out to be the reason behind the mysterious symptoms.
meanings.sent4: In the body, hexosaminidase deficiency is like having a missing puzzle piece.
meanings.sent5: The importance of hexosaminidase becomes clear when its absence causes serious health issues.
